pullRequest.title: Create Extension using codestarts
pullRequest.bodyText:
Replace (and break) the current create-extension mojo using codestarts and with simpler parameters.
The legacy mojo is now create-extension-legacy.
In this implementation, it supports creating:

a Quarkus Core extension from the quarkus or quarkus/extensions dir
a (single) Quarkiverse extension using -DgroupId=io.quarkiverse.[extensionId]
a standalone extension from any other dir with another groupId

from the quarkus dir, or any other dir:
mvn io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:create-extension -N
or quarkiverse:
mvn io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:create-extension -N -DgroupId=io.quarkiverse.aloha
You need to also pay a good attention to the updated guides:

docs/src/main/asciidoc/building-my-first-extension.adoc
docs/src/main/asciidoc/writing-extensions.adoc

I've added backward compat for the artifactId which now is replaced by extensionId:

artifactId=quarkus-aloha ->  extensionId=aloha and namespaceId=quarkus-
artifactId=aloha ->  extensionId=aloha and namespaceId=""
artifactId=something-aloha ->  extensionId=something-aloha and namespaceId=""


This PR also introduce snapshot testing for generated code SnapshotTesting and use it in some of our existing tests:
assertThatMatchSnapshot(testInfo, projectDir, "src/main/java/org/acme/GreetingResource.java")
    .satisfies(checkContains("@Path(\"/hello\")"));
and to check a directory tree:
assertThatDirectoryTreeMatchSnapshots(testInfo, projectDir);
The snapshots let us review the output of the command and make sure future changes are working as expected.
Snapshots are automatically generated in src/test/resources/__snapshots__/... on first run or can be manually updated using -Dsnap or -DupdateSnapshots.

Sorry for the size of this PR:

it lasted way more than I expected
it includes the snapshots which introduce new files
it mostly affect the create-extension mojo and code generation tests so the risk is limited


Closes #12522

nodes.bodyText: Is this System.out necessary or can it use a logger instead?
Rename this file to LICENSE (with an S) - because that's the file GitHub creates when you choose to add a LICENSE (yeah, not British English :))
The Quarkiverse extension is not generating a name for the integration-test module.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,127 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+{#if it-parent}
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>{it-parent.group-id}</groupId>
+        <artifactId>{it-parent.artifact-id}</artifactId>
+        <version>{it-parent.version}</version>
+        {#if it-parent.relative-path}
+        <relativePath>{it-parent.relative-path}</relativePath>
+        {/if}
+    </parent>
+{/if}
+    <artifactId>{namespace.id}{extension.id}-integration-test</artifactId>
+{#if name.base && name.prefix}
+    <name>{name.prefix}{name.base}{name.segment-delimiter}Integration Test</name>

nodes.bodyText: Hint: these properties can be moved as getters inside the LayoutType enum above
